title: Previewing Japan’s Leadership Election and Implications for U.S.-Japan Relations
description: The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) will host a telephone briefing on Tuesday, September 28, 2021, at 8:15 a.m. ET to preview the leadership election of Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party scheduled for September 29.

title: All That Glitters Is Not Green
description: Carbon offsets can be a win-win situation: emitters invest in needed environmental projects, and environmental projects receive funding, leading greenhouse emissions to decline. However, carbon offsets are poorly regulated and can sometimes disincentivize decarbonization.

title: The Future of U.S. Leadership in Multilateral Development Institutions: A Playbook for the Next 10 Years
description: A new PPD report finds that U.S. global leadership in the multilateral system has waned over the past 30 years due to lack of government strategy, de-prioritization of multilateral system career paths, and a deficient approach to leadership and staffing within the system.

title: The Evening: Biden Booster, German Elections, Money for Nothing, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Biden Booster, German Elections, Money for Nothing, and More.

title: What the Taliban Takeover Means for Food Security in Afghanistan
description: To address the growing hunger crisis in Afghanistan, the international community should quickly remove restrictive measures on humanitarian aid. Strengthening local agricultural systems and capacity is also imperative to stabilize the country’s long-term food security.

title: Digital Transformation in the Western Hemisphere
description: Digital transformation policies and initiatives can be helpful for countries of the Western Hemisphere to adapt when preparing for two certainties: an aging population and disasters.

title: Unforced Errors
description: This week, the Scholl Chair evaluates the United States' ongoing and long-standing relationship with the European Union. How has the Biden administration's approach affected the outlook for transatlantic relations?

title: Working toward a Just Transition for Coal Communities
description: Policies to decarbonize the U.S. power sector have important repercussions for fossil fuel workers and communities. Congress and the Biden administration are seeking to support coal communities but should apply the principles and lessons learned from past transitions.

title: The Adversary Gets a Vote
description: The strategic concept of “integrated deterrence” is gaining prominence as the Department of Defense further develops it—but how might advanced situational awareness capabilities erode stable nuclear deterrence and fuel reactionary arms racing?

title: Addressing an Aging Population through Digital Transformation in the Western Hemisphere
description: As populations in Latin America and the Caribbean age, countries can and should prepare for the upcoming reality of a significant demographic shift. The Americas Program explores how adapting age-friendly digital solutions can help mitigate the effects of an aging society.

title: RESOLVED: Japan Is Entering a Period of Political Instability
description: On September 29, the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) will hold an election to determine the next president of the LDP, who will succeed Prime Minister Yoshihide Suga and lead the party in an upcoming parliamentary election.

title: Disaster Risk Reduction through Digital Transformation in the Western Hemisphere
description: As populations in Latin America and the Caribbean age, countries can and should prepare for the upcoming reality of a significant demographic shift. The Americas Program explores how adapting age-friendly digital solutions can help mitigate the effects of an aging society.
